Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track IoT Hub metrics such as message throughput, device connectivity, and error rates. Investigate anomalies promptly.
Conduct regular security audits to ensure IoT Hub configurations comply with organizational security policies and industry standards.
Rotate device authentication keys periodically to maintain security and prevent unauthorized access.
Regularly back up IoT Hub configurations, including device identities, routing rules, and message settings, to ensure recoverability in case of failure.
Conduct failover and disaster recovery tests to ensure IoT Hub can recover from outages or disruptions without data loss.

Tasks.Task: Review IoT Hub Usage and Costs
Tasks.Task Description: Analyze IoT Hub usage and associated costs to optimize resource allocation and reduce unnecessary expenses.
Ensure IoT Hub SDKs used by devices and applications are updated to the latest versions to leverage new features and security improvements.
Verify that all registered devices are actively connected and communicating with IoT Hub as expected. Investigate and resolve connectivity issues.
Keep IoT Hub operational and configuration documentation up-to-date, including device onboarding procedures and troubleshooting guides.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security breaches or IoT Hub outages. Ensure familiarity with protocols.
Audit and update message routing rules to ensure data is being sent to the correct endpoints and complies with business requirements.
Review IoT Hub's performance against its SLA to ensure compliance and address any deviations.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new IoT Hub features, best practices, and security measures.
Gather feedback from IoT Hub users to identify areas for improvement and implement necessary changes.
